```{r}
arradata <- array(1:27, dim = c(2,2,3))
firstlayer =  arradata[,,1]

for (i in firstlayer){
  print(i)
}


for (i in 1:2) { 
  for (j in 1:3) { 
    print(arradata[i, j, 1]) }}


arradata <- array(1:27, dim = c(2,2,3))

firstlayer = arradata[,,1]

for (i in seq_along(firstlayer)) {
  print(firstlayer[i])
}


arradata <- array(1:27, dim = c(2,2,3))

for (layer in 1:dim(arradata)[3]) {
  print(arradata[1,1,layer])
}

for(i in dim(arradata)){
  print(i)
}

# Create the array
arradata <- array(1:27, dim = c(2, 2, 3))

# Get the dimensions of the array
dims <- dim(arradata)

# Iterate through the layers
for (i in 1:dims[3]) {
  # Print the first element in each layer
  cat("Layer", i, ":", arradata[1, 1, i], "\n")
}

```

df[df[age == 3]]

```{r}
# Assuming df3 is your data frame
for (i in 1:dim(df3)[2]) {
  cat("Name:", df3$Name[i], ", Age:", df3$age[i], "\n")
}
 
for (i in 1:nrow(df3)) {
  print(paste("Name:", df3[i, "Name"], "- Age:", df3[i, "age"]))
}

```
